==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|角|t1=horn|刀|t2=knife|牛|t3=cow|ls=ic}} – a knife separates a horn from a cow, i.e. “cut up (an ox)”.

===Etymology===
Three pronunciations are cognate. "To loosen; to disengage" > "idle, lazy, remiss". Cognate with {{och-l|懈|lazy, remiss}} and possibly {{zh-l|*邂逅|tr=*ɡreːs ɡroːs|carefree and happy}}.

? Area stem: *''C-re''. Compare {{cog|my|ဖြေ||to untie; to answer; to ease; to absolve}}, {{m|my|အဖြေ||answer, solution; response; explication}}; {{cog|km|រាយ||to scatter, to be divided up, to separate}}, {{m|km|ស្រាយ||to untie, to undo, to explain, to solve}}.
